InfoPage.welcome: Welcome to Trader Map! Below you'll find a clear explanation of our main features, key trading terms, and how to interpret your smart alert cards.

items.traderMap: Provides an overview of the markets and real-time trades. Think of it as your main dashboard to see running smart alerts in one place, building your strategy around them.
items.signals: Displays all active and past smart alerts. Each smart alert will show whether it's a Long or Short trade, entry price, exit price (if closed), and performance metrics.
items.profile: Your account page to view or update personal info, adjust subscription plans, or set preferences like notifications and alerts.

tradingTerms.title: Key Trading Terms in the App

mae.title: MAE (Maximum Adverse Excursion)
mae.description: MAE measures how far a trade moved against you (i.e., how much 'adverse' price movement you encountered) before the trade was closed. A higher MAE suggests the trade spent some time in negative territory before potentially turning profitable or being stopped out.

mfe.title: MFE (Maximum Favorable Excursion)
mfe.description: MFE tracks the biggest unrealized gain achieved during a trade before it was closed. If your trade is 'in profit' by 10 ticks at some point, but it closes at 5 ticks, then the MFE was 10 ticks.

exitPrice.title: Exit Price
exitPrice.description: The exact price at which the position was closed. This value is automatically recorded once the trade finishes (either by hitting a target, a stop, or manual close).

tradeDuration.title: Trade Duration
tradeDuration.description: How long the position remained open, measured in minutes or hours. The app calculates this from the time you entered (Entry Price) to the time you exited (Exit Price).

signalCards.title: Smart Alert Cards
signalCards.description: Smart alerts in Trader Map are shown via specialized cards. Each card contains trade details including the type of trade (Long or Short), status, entry/exit prices, and performance metrics.

running.title: Running Smart Alert Card
running.description: Displays trades that are actively in progress:
running.item0: Entry Price: The price at which the trade was opened.
running.item1: Target Price: The desired profit-taking level.
running.item2: Stop Loss Price: The protective stop-loss level.
running.item3: Current Price: Shows the live price with real-time updates.
running.item4: Visual Price Scale: Shows where the current price is in relation to entry, target, and stop.

fulfilled.title: Fulfilled Smart Alert Card
fulfilled.description: Displays trades that have already closed:
fulfilled.item0: Potential Profit: The maximum possible profit that was available during the trade.
fulfilled.item1: MFE (Maximum Favorable Excursion): Shows the best possible outcome the trade reached.
fulfilled.item2: MAE (Maximum Adverse Excursion): Shows the maximum risk or drawdown during the trade.
fulfilled.item3: Trade Quality: Some cards show badges like 'Expert Trade' or 'Quality Trade' based on their risk/reward profile.

marketClosed.title: Market Closed Card
marketClosed.description: Shown when the market for an instrument is currently closed:
marketClosed.item0: Next Open Time: Shows when the market will next be open (in both UTC and local time).
marketClosed.item1: Countdown Timer: Displays how much time remains until the market opens.
marketClosed.item2: Trading Hours: Shows the regular trading schedule for this instrument.
marketClosed.item3: Trading Days: Visual representation of which days the market is open.

systemClosed.title: System Closed Card
systemClosed.description: Appears when our alert system is not actively monitoring an instrument:
systemClosed.item0: Next Alert Session: When the system will resume monitoring this instrument.
systemClosed.item1: Session Schedule: Shows the times when alerts are active.
systemClosed.item2: Session Days: Shows which days of the week have active monitoring.
systemClosed.item3: Countdown: Shows the time remaining until alerts resume.

signalTool.title: Smart Alert Tool (Notifications, Volume, Favorites) - Pro Users
signalTool.description: Each smart alert can be customized to suit your preferences:

items.notifications: Turn these on if you’d like to receive alerts (in-app or Telegram) when certain conditions are met for that smart alert.
items.volume: Enable or disable sound alerts for new smart alerts, so you can hear a beep when a trade triggers.
items.favorite: Mark a smart alert as a favorite to find or filter it more easily in your dashboard.

alerts.title: Alerts
alerts.description: You can see all recent alerts in the 'Alerts' section. These notifications inform you about new opportunities or changes in the market. If you’re a Pro user, you can also filter which instruments you receive alerts for. Otherwise, you’ll see all general alerts.
alerts.sampleAlert: (10/21) 20:30 - Alert: Potential Long Opportunity on NQ - Level 21992.75 Stay vigilant.

realtime.title: Real-time Updates
realtime.description: Our cards provide live data with automatic updates. No need to refresh for the latest information.

visualization.title: Visual Price Tracking
visualization.description: Price scales and visual indicators help you quickly understand the trade's status and performance.

status.title: Clear Status Indicators
status.description: Colored headers and badges make it easy to distinguish between different types of signals and market conditions.

context.title: Market Context
context.description: Cards provide relevant market information like trading hours and scheduled sessions for better decision-making.

hero.subtitle: Stay Ahead of the Market with Automated Insights and Timely Notifications

offers.mainTitle: Live Smart Alerts – Stay Ahead of the Market
offers.subtitle: Our real-time smart alerts provide you with expert-driven market insights, helping you make informed trading decisions quickly.
offers.bottomText: With our real-time smart alerts, you'll never miss a trading opportunity again!

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.moreQuestions: Can't find what you're looking for?

question1.question: What are Smart Alerts, and how can they help me trade?
question1.answer: Smart Alerts are real-time trading signals designed to help traders react quickly to market opportunities. Each alert provides essential trade details, including whether it's a Long or Short trade, entry and exit prices, and key performance metrics like Maximum Favorable Excursion (MFE) and Maximum Adverse Excursion (MAE). With Smart Alerts, you can make informed trading decisions and stay ahead of the market.

question2.question: How do I receive Smart Alerts notifications?
question2.answer: You can receive Smart Alerts through multiple channels: In-App Notifications: Stay updated directly from the Trader Map dashboard. Telegram Notifications (Pro Users Only): Connect your Telegram account to get real-time alerts straight to your phone. Sound Alerts: Enable audio notifications in settings to hear an alert when a trade is triggered.

question3.question: What is the difference between the Free and Pro plans?
question3.answer: The Free Plan provides access to a limited number of Smart Alerts and basic analysis of the instruments. Pro users, on the other hand, get full access to all Smart Alerts, detailed analysis of the instruments, Telegram notifications, alerts on upcoming trades, and custom Smart Alert preferences.

SignalTable.title: Trade MFE & Loss Ticks/Pips Performance Summary
SignalTable.subTitle: Analyze trade performance metrics and trends

toolTips.1: Total number of completed trades in the dataset
toolTips.2: Sum of all Maximum Favorable Excursion ticks/pips across all trades
toolTips.3: Sum of all negative movement ticks/pips across all trades
toolTips.4: Average Maximum Favorable Excursion ticks/pips per trade
toolTips.5: Average negative movement ticks/pips per trade

tooltips.date: The date when the trade was entered. This shows when the position was opened in the format day/month/year.
tooltips.entryPrice: The exact price at which the trade position was opened. This is the price level where your position was established in the market.
tooltips.exitPrice: The exact price at which the position was closed. This value is automatically recorded once the trade finishes either by hitting a target, a stop, or manual close.
tooltips.tradeSide: Indicates whether the trade was a Long position (betting on price increase) or Short position (betting on price decrease). This shows the trade direction.
tooltips.duration: How long the position remained open, measured in hours, minutes, or seconds. The app calculates this from the time you entered (Entry Price) to the time you exited (Exit Price).
tooltips.mfeTicks: MFE (Maximum Favorable Excursion) tracks the biggest unrealized gain achieved during a trade before it was closed. If your trade was 'in profit' by 10 ticks at some point but closes at 5 ticks, then the MFE was 10 ticks. This helps you understand how much potential profit was available during the trade.
tooltips.lossTicks: Shows how many ticks the trade moved against your position. This represents the negative movement in your trade. Higher loss ticks indicate that the trade experienced more adverse movement, which could have triggered stop losses or resulted in greater drawdowns.

collect.title: 1. Information We Collect
collect.content: We collect information that you provide directly to us, such as when you sign up, contact support, or use our services. This may include personal details like your name, email address, and transaction history.

use.title: 2. How We Use Your Information
use.content: We use your information to provide, improve, and personalize our services. This includes processing transactions, sending notifications, and enhancing user experience.

security.title: 3. Data Sharing & Security
security.content: We do not sell your personal information. We may share data with trusted partners for operational purposes, but we ensure appropriate security measures are in place to protect your privacy.

rights.title: 4. Your Rights & Choices
rights.content: You have the right to access, modify, or request deletion of your personal data. You may also opt-out of certain data processing activities by contacting us.

changes.title: 5. Changes to This Policy
changes.content: We reserve the right to update this privacy policy at any time. We will notify users of significant changes through our platform.

contact.title: 6. Contact Information
contact.content: If you have any questions about this privacy policy, contact us at support@trader-map.com

TermsAndConditions.title: Terms and Conditions
TermsAndConditions.welcome: Welcome to Trader Map. By using our website and services, you agree to comply with the following terms and conditions. Please read them carefully.

acceptance.title: 1. Acceptance of Terms
acceptance.content: By accessing and using our services, you accept and agree to be bound by these Terms and Conditions. If you do not agree, please do not use our services.

use.title: 2. Use of Services
use.content: Our services, including smart alerts, are intended for informational and educational purposes only. We do not provide financial, investment, tax, legal, or accounting advice. Users should exercise caution and consult with licensed professionals before making any financial decisions.

account.title: 3. Account Registration and Security
account.content: Users must provide accurate and complete information when creating an account. You are responsible for maintaining the confidentiality of your login credentials and are liable for all activities under your account.

prohibited.title: 4. Prohibited Activities
prohibited.content: Users agree not to engage in activities including, but not limited to: - Using our platform for fraudulent purposes. - Distributing harmful or malicious content. - Violating intellectual property rights. - Engaging in unauthorized data collection.

payment.title: 5. Payment and Subscription
payment.content: Certain features require a paid subscription. Payments are billed monthly and must be made through approved payment providers. Failure to make timely payments may result in suspension or termination of services.

termination.title: 6. Termination of Service
termination.content: We reserve the right to terminate or suspend access to our services at any time, without notice, for violations of these Terms and Conditions.

ip.title: 7. Intellectual Property
ip.content: All content provided on this website, including text, graphics, logos, and software, is the property of Trader Map and is protected by copyright laws.

liability.title: 8. Limitation of Liability
liability.content: Trader Map is not responsible for any financial losses resulting from the use of our services. Users should conduct their own research and consult with licensed professionals before making financial decisions.

dispute.title: 9. Dispute Resolution
dispute.content: Any disputes arising from these terms will be resolved through arbitration in accordance with applicable laws.

amendments.title: 10. Amendments
amendments.content: We reserve the right to modify these terms at any time. Users will be notified of significant changes.

disclaimer.title: 11. Disclaimer
disclaimer.content: All information, smart alerts, tools, and materials provided by Trader Map are for informational and educational purposes only and do not constitute financial advice. Trader Map is not a registered investment advisor or broker-dealer, and nothing on our platform should be construed as a recommendation to buy or sell securities or any other financial instrument. Users should consult with licensed professionals before making any financial decisions.

policy.title: 1. No Refunds Policy
policy.content: All purchases made on Trader Map are final. Due to the nature of digital products and services, we do not offer refunds or exchanges.

exceptions.title: 2. Exceptions
exceptions.content: Refunds may be issued in rare cases where there has been a billing error or if the service has not been delivered as described. Any requests for exceptions must be submitted within 7 days of purchase.

request.title: 3. How to Request a Refund
request.content: To request a refund (if applicable), please contact us at support@trader-map.com with your transaction details and reason for the request.

processing.title: 4. Processing Time
processing.content: If a refund is approved, it will be processed within 5-10 business days. Refunds will be credited back to the original payment method.

InstrumentStatusCard.trendTooltip: Market trend direction derived from technical analysis. Bullish indicates upward momentum, Bearish indicates downward momentum, and Neutral indicates sideways movement.
InstrumentStatusCard.lastPriceTooltip: The most recent price at which the instrument traded. Updated in real-time as new trades occur.
InstrumentStatusCard.highTooltip: The highest price the instrument has reached during the current session or time period.
InstrumentStatusCard.lowTooltip: The lowest price the instrument has reached during the current session or time period.
InstrumentStatusCard.vwapTooltip: Volume-Weighted Average Price. A trading indicator that shows the average price of an instrument weighted by volume, helping identify fair value.
InstrumentStatusCard.pocTooltip: Point of Control. The price level with the highest traded volume, representing the price where most trading activity occurred.
InstrumentStatusCard.vpocTooltip: Volume Point of Control. Similar to POC but specifically focuses on the price level with the largest volume concentration.
InstrumentStatusCard.vahTooltip: Value Area High. The upper boundary of the price range where 70% of trading volume occurred, indicating significant activity.
InstrumentStatusCard.valTooltip: Value Area Low. The lower boundary of the price range where 70% of trading volume occurred, indicating significant activity.

steps.trackDescription: Monitor your referrals, conversions, and earnings through your dashboard.

howItWorks.note: Our commission structure is designed to reward both quality and quantity. The more qualified users you refer, the higher your commission rate becomes.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Everything you need to know about our affiliate program

questions.payment: When and how do I get paid?
questions.materials: What marketing materials do you provide?
questions.terms: What are the terms of the affiliate agreement?
questions.support: How can I get support as an affiliate?

answers.eligibilityAnswer: Our affiliate program is open to traders, financial bloggers, trading educators, financial influencers, and website owners with relevant audiences. We review all applications to ensure alignment with our product and values.
answers.trackingAnswer: We use reliable affiliate tracking software that assigns unique tracking links to each affiliate. When someone clicks your link, they're tracked for 30 days, and you earn commission on any subscription they purchase during that period.
answers.paymentAnswer: Commissions are calculated monthly and paid on the 15th of the following month via PayPal, bank transfer, or crypto (minimum payout threshold: $50). You'll earn from 20-40% of the subscription value depending on your tier.
answers.materialsAnswer: We provide banners, text links, landing pages, email templates, product images, and demo videos. We also offer custom materials for high-performing affiliates and can work with you to create targeted campaigns.
answers.termsAnswer: Our agreement requires ethical promotion without misleading claims or spam tactics. Affiliates cannot bid on our branded terms in paid search. Commission cookies last 30 days, and we reserve the right to reject applications or terminate partnerships that don't align with our policies.
answers.supportAnswer: You'll have access to our affiliate support team via email and chat. High-volume affiliates get dedicated account managers. We also provide regular updates, optimization tips, and training materials to help maximize your success.

hero.title: About Trader Map
hero.subtitle: We're on a mission to empower traders with intelligent market insights and real-time alerts.

story.title: Our Story
story.paragraph1: Trader Map was founded in 2022 by a team of passionate traders and technologists who recognized the need for more intelligent trading tools in an increasingly complex market landscape.
story.paragraph2: What began as an internal tool to enhance our own trading has evolved into a comprehensive platform used by traders worldwide. We've spent thousands of hours researching, testing, and refining our algorithms to create smart alerts that actually work.
story.paragraph3: Today, our team continues to innovate at the intersection of trading and technology, with the goal of giving every trader—from beginners to professionals—the insights they need to make more informed decisions.

values.title: Our Values
values.subtitle: These core principles guide everything we do at Trader Map

innovation.title: Innovation
innovation.description: We constantly push boundaries to create trading tools that solve real problems and deliver actionable insights.

integrity.title: Integrity
integrity.description: We believe in transparency, honesty, and ethical practices in all our operations and communications.

community.title: Community
community.description: We're building more than a platform—we're creating a community of traders who support each other's success.

descriptions.ceo: With over 15 years of trading experience across multiple markets, Alex leads our company vision and strategic direction.
descriptions.cto: Maria oversees our technical infrastructure and leads our development team in creating innovative solutions for traders.
descriptions.head_of_research: David leads our research initiatives, developing and refining the algorithms behind our smart alerts system.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Find answers to common questions about our pricing and features

questions.differences: What's the difference between Monthly and Lifetime plans?
questions.cancel: Can I cancel my subscription at any time?
questions.cryptoPayment: How do I pay with cryptocurrency?
questions.teamPlans: Do you offer team or company plans?

answers.differencesAnswer: The Monthly plan gives you full access to all features for $65 per month with the flexibility to cancel anytime. The Lifetime plan is a one-time payment of $800 that gives you permanent access to the platform and all future updates with no recurring fees - making it the best value for serious traders.
answers.cancelAnswer: Yes, you can cancel your monthly subscription at any time from your account settings. If you cancel, you'll continue to have access to your paid features until the end of your current billing period.
answers.refundAnswer: All sales are final. Due to the nature of our digital products and immediate access to premium content, we do not offer refunds. Please choose your plan carefully before making a purchase.
answers.cryptoPaymentAnswer: During checkout, select the cryptocurrency payment option and you'll be redirected to our secure crypto payment processor. You can pay with Bitcoin, Ethereum, USDC, or USDT. After payment confirmation (typically within minutes), your account will be upgraded automatically. We also offer a 5% discount on all plans when paying with cryptocurrency.
answers.teamPlansAnswer: Yes, we offer special pricing for trading firms and teams of 5 or more users. Our team plans include additional features like collaborative workspaces, shared alert libraries, and a dedicated account manager. Please contact our sales team for a custom quote.

Faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
Faq.description: Find answers to common questions about Trader Map, our smart alerts, pricing plans, and features.

support.title: Still need help?
support.description: If you can't find an answer to your question, our support team is ready to help.

q1.question: What is Trader Map?
q1.answer: Trader Map is a specialized platform for traders that provides real-time smart alerts for various financial instruments. Our system continuously monitors markets and sends you actionable trading signals based on technical analysis and market patterns.

q2.question: How do I get started with Trader Map?
q2.answer:
Getting started is easy:
  1. Create a free account
  2. Explore the available smart alerts in the dashboard
  3. Set up your notification preferences
  4. Optionally, upgrade to a Pro plan for full access

q3.question: Do I need trading experience to use Trader Map?
q3.answer: While Trader Map is designed to be user-friendly for traders of all levels, having a basic understanding of trading concepts will help you get the most out of our smart alerts. We provide educational resources to help beginners understand our alerts and how to use them in their trading strategies.

q4.question: What's the difference between Monthly and Lifetime plans?
q4.answer: The Monthly plan gives you full access to all features for $65 per month with the flexibility to cancel anytime. The Lifetime plan is a one-time payment of $800 that gives you permanent access to the platform and all future updates with no recurring fees - making it the best value for serious traders.

q5.question: Can I cancel my subscription at any time?
q5.answer: Yes, you can cancel your monthly subscription at any time from your account settings. If you cancel, you'll continue to have access to your paid features until the end of your current billing period. There are no refunds for partial months.

q6.question: What payment methods do you accept?
q6.answer: We accept payment through PayPal (which supports most credit/debit cards) and various cryptocurrencies through our integration with NowPayments. This gives you flexibility in how you prefer to pay for your subscription.

q7.question: What are Smart Alerts and how do they work?
q7.answer:
Smart Alerts are our proprietary trading signals that identify potential trading opportunities based on technical analysis, price action, and market patterns. Each alert provides key information including:
  • Entry price recommendations
  • Stop-loss levels
  • Target price levels
  • Risk/reward ratio
  • Performance metrics like MAE (Maximum Adverse Excursion) and MFE (Maximum Favorable Excursion)

q8.question: What instruments do your Smart Alerts cover?
q8.answer:
Our Smart Alerts cover over 50 different trading instruments including:
  • Major futures markets (ES, NQ, YM, RTY)
  • Commodities (Gold, Oil, Natural Gas)
  • Forex pairs
  • And more
Both free and Pro plans have access to different instruments, with the Pro plan offering a complete range.

q9.question: How are Smart Alerts delivered to me?
q9.answer:
Smart Alerts are delivered through multiple channels:
  • Directly in the Trader Map platform
  • Via Telegram notifications (Pro users only)
  • Optional sound alerts in the web application
You can customize your notification preferences in your account settings.

q10.question: Is Trader Map available on mobile devices?
q10.answer: Yes, Trader Map is fully responsive and works on all modern mobile devices. You can access all features through your mobile browser. Additionally, Pro users can receive alerts via Telegram, making it even easier to stay updated while on the go.

q11.question: How secure is my data with Trader Map?
q11.answer: We take data security very seriously. All connections to our platform are encrypted using SSL. We don't store any sensitive payment information - all payments are processed through our trusted partners (PayPal and NowPayments). Your account credentials are securely hashed, and we implement industry-standard security practices to protect your data.

q12.question: Can I connect Trader Map to my trading platform?
q12.answer: Currently, Trader Map operates as a standalone alert system. While we don't offer direct integration with trading platforms, you can easily take the information from our Smart Alerts and implement trades in your preferred trading platform. We may introduce API access and platform integrations in future updates.
